CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The 'title' key allows for HTML injection through the .html() method. An attacker could potentially inject malicious scripts by passing them as the 'value' parameter when 'key' is 'title'. This could lead to various security issues, such as stealing sensitive data or performing actions on behalf of the user.
